column4: OK, is anyone here running a jabber server on Edgy-Server, and able to recommend it?
not ubuntu, but running an enterprise jabber server on debian
I'm just looking for a single-server solution, but MUC, audio, and video (if available in the client) would be good.
Define "enterprise jabber server".
I doubt I'll have more than a dozen users, maximum.
a jabber installation supporting 107k+ users?
I used to use ejabberd, but for some reason it's gone belly up and refuses to even give me useful error messages.
Yeah, way out of the league I need. :-)
Which server?
Which jabber server, specifically?
jabberd 2.x branch, it's at an .edu.  we don't ever have that many concurrent users of course.
How is it for setup and config?
When I was last looking into jabber servers 2 years ago, IIRC jabber 2.x was rather shaky.
not bad, was able to delegate it out to someone else and he managed to get it working
managed.  That doesn't instill confidence. ;-)
you don't know him.  =)
hehe.
jabberd supported ldap and postgresql, both of which we needed
And of course only jabber 1.x is in the edgy repository.
I doubt I'll be using either, although good to know if I ever setup LDAP just to see if I can.
